1.X.X.name: Informational
1.X.X.description: The request was received, continuing process

100.name: Continue
100.description: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body

101.name: Switching Protocols
101.description: The requester has asked the server to switch protocols and the server has agreed to do so

102.name: Processing
102.description: A WebDAV request may contain many sub-requests involving file operations, requiring a long time to complete the request

103.name: Early Hints
103.description: Used to return some response headers before final HTTP message

2.X.X.name: Successful
2.X.X.description: The request was successfully received, understood, and accepted

200.name: OK
200.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests

201.name: Created
201.description: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource

202.name: Accepted
202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed

203.name: Non-Authoritative Information
203.description: The server is a transforming proxy that received a 200 OK from its origin, but is returning a modified version of the origin's response

204.name: No Content
204.description: The server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content

205.name: Reset Content
205.description: The server successfully processed the request, asks that the requester reset its document view, and is not returning any content

206.name: Partial Content
206.description: The server is delivering only part of the resource due to a range header sent by the client

207.name: Multi-Status
207.description: The message body that follows is an XML message and can contain a number of separate response codes

208.name: Already Reported
208.description: The members of a DAV binding have already been enumerated in a preceding part of the (multistatus) response

226.name: IM Used
226.description: The server has fulfilled a request for the resource, and the response is a representation of the result of one or more instance-manipulations applied to the current instance

3.X.X.name: Redirection
3.X.X.description: Further action needs to be taken in order to complete the request

300.name: Multiple Choices
300.description: Indicates multiple options for the resource from which the client may choose

301.name: Moved Permanently
301.description: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI

302.name: Found
302.description: Tells the client to look at (browse to) another URL

303.name: See Other
303.description: The response to the request can be found under another URI using the GET method

304.name: Not Modified
304.description: Indicates that the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request headers

305.name: Use Proxy
305.description: The requested resource is available only through a proxy

307.name: Temporary Redirect
307.description: The request should be repeated with another URI, but future requests should still use the original URI

308.name: Permanent Redirect
308.description: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI

4.X.X.name: Client Error
4.X.X.description: The request contains bad syntax or cannot be fulfilled

400.name: Bad Request
400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error

401.name: Unauthorized
401.description: Authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided

403.name: Forbidden
403.description: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action

404.name: Not Found
404.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future

405.name: Method Not Allowed
405.description: A request method is not supported for the requested resource

406.name: Not Acceptable
406.description: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request

407.name: Proxy Authentication Required
407.description: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy

408.name: Request Timeout
408.description: The server timed out waiting for the request

409.name: Conflict
409.description: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource

410.name: Gone
410.description: Indicates that the resource requested was previously in use but is no longer available and will not be available again

411.name: Length Required
411.description: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource

412.name: Precondition Failed
412.description: The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request header fields

413.name: Payload Too Large
413.description: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process

414.name: URI Too Long
414.description: The URI provided was too long for the server to process

415.name: Unsupported Media Type
415.description: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support

416.name: Range Not Satisfiable
416.description: The client has asked for a portion of the file (byte serving), but the server cannot supply that portion

417.name: Expectation Failed
417.description: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field

418.name: I'm a teapot
418.description: This code was defined in 1998 as one of the traditional IETF April Fools' jokes

421.name: Misdirected Request
421.description: The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response

422.name: Unprocessable Content
422.description: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors

423.name: Locked
423.description: The resource that is being accessed is locked

424.name: Failed Dependency
424.description: The request failed because it depended on another request and that request failed

425.name: Too Early
425.description: Indicates that the server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed

426.name: Upgrade Required
426.description: The client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.3

428.name: Precondition Required
428.description: The origin server requires the request to be conditional

429.name: Too Many Requests
429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time

431.name: Request Header Fields Too Large
431.description: The server is unwilling to process the request because either an individual header field, or all the header fields collectively, are too large

451.name: Unavailable For Legal Reasons
451.description: A server operator has received a legal demand to deny access to a resource or to a set of resources

5.X.X.name: Server Error
5.X.X.description: The server failed to fulfill an apparently valid request

500.name: Internal Server Error
500.description: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable

501.name: Not Implemented
501.description: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfill the request

502.name: Bad Gateway
502.description: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server

503.name: Service Unavailable
503.description: The server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance)

504.name: Gateway Timeout
504.description: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server

505.name: HTTP Version Not Supported
505.description: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request

506.name: Variant Also Negotiates
506.description: Transparent content negotiation for the request results in a circular reference

507.name: Insufficient Storage
507.description: The server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request

508.name: Loop Detected
508.description: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request

510.name: Not Extended
510.description: Further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfill it

511.name: Network Authentication Required
511.description: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access

Others.name: Unofficial Codes
Others.description: These codes are not specified by any standard

218.name: This is fine
218.description: Used by Apache servers as a catch-all error condition

419.name: Page Expired
419.description: Used by the Laravel Framework when a CSRF Token is missing or expired

420.name: Method Failure
420.description: A deprecated response used by the Spring Framework when a method has failed

430.name: Request Header Fields Too Large
430.description: Used by Shopify, instead of the 429 Too Many Requests response code

450.name: Blocked by Windows Parental Controls
450.description: The Microsoft extension code indicated when Windows Parental Controls are turned on and are blocking access to the requested webpage

498.name: Invalid Token
498.description: Returned by ArcGIS for Server. Code 498 indicates an expired or otherwise invalid token

499.name: Token Required
499.description: Returned by ArcGIS for Server. Code 499 indicates that a token is required but was not submitted

509.name: Bandwidth Limit Exceeded
509.description: The server has exceeded the bandwidth specified by the server administrator

529.name: Site is overloaded
529.description: Used by Qualys in the SSLLabs server testing API to signal that the site can not process the request

530.name: Site is frozen
530.description: Used by the Pantheon Systems web platform to indicate a site that has been frozen due to inactivity

598.name: Network read timeout error
598.description: Used by some HTTP proxies to signal a network read timeout behind the proxy to a client in front of the proxy

599.name: Network Connect Timeout Error
599.description: An error used by some HTTP proxies to signal a network connect timeout behind the proxy to a client in front of the proxy
